lead_paragraph: A cell biologist, Dr. Ohsumi was recognized for his work on autophagy, the process by which cells recycle their content.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno and Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo.
byline.original: By GINA KOLATA and SEWELL CHAN

headline.print_headline: Using Baker’s Yeast to Reveal the Secret Life of Self-Eating Cells
headline.main: Yoshinori Ohsumi of Japan Wins Nobel Prize for Study of ‘Self-Eating’ Cells

snippet: A cell biologist, Dr. Ohsumi was recognized for his work on autophagy, the process by which cells recycle their content....
abstract: Japanese cell biologist Yoshinori Ohsumi is awarded Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his work explaining how cells recycle content, process known as autophagy; explanation of why Ohsumi won, as well as who he is and global reactions to award, provided.
